abstract.p: Shares of Egg PLC, British Internet bank owned by Prudential PLC, rise on their first day of trading, closing at 177.5 pence; Prudential sold 20 percent stake at 160 pence per share, raising 235 million pounds or about $350 million (S)

block.p: Shares in the British Internet bank owned by Prudential P.L.C., Egg P.L.C., rose on their first day of trading, closing at 177.5 pence. Prudential sold a 20 percent stake at 160 pence per share, raising $:235 million or about $350 million. The offering valued Egg at more than $:1.4 billion, or $2.1 billion, half of what analysts were forecasting a few months ago. Since then more than 40 European companies have shied from such offerings because of a fall in Internet-related share prices.
